etymology.description: 胸(chest) + 大(big) + 无(no) + 脑(brain) = big chest but no brains; derogatory stereotype.
etymology.interpretation: Colloquial, pejorative slang stereotyping a woman as having large breasts but lacking intelligence; widely viewed as sexist and offensive. Best avoided in respectful or professional contexts.
etymology.simplification: 无 is the simplified form of 無 and 脑 is the simplified form of 腦, reducing strokes for ease of writing; 胸 and 大 are unchanged.

examples.chinese: 他用“胸大无脑”评价同事(他用「胸大無腦」評價同事)，结果引起了不满(結果引起了不滿)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng “xiōng dà wú nǎo” píngjià tóngshì, jiéguǒ yǐnqǐle bùmǎn.
examples.english: He described a colleague as a “bimbo,” which caused resentment.

examples.chinese: 这种说法带有性别歧视(這種說法帶有性別歧視)，请不要随便使用(請不要隨便使用)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng shuōfǎ dàiyǒu xìngbié qíshì, qǐng búyào suíbiàn shǐyòng.
examples.english: This expression is sexist; please don’t use it casually.

examples.chinese: 有些人把它当玩笑(有些人把它當玩笑)，但可能伤害当事人(但可能傷害當事人)。
examples.pinyin: Yǒuxiē rén bǎ tā dāng wánxiào, dàn kěnéng shānghài dāngshìrén.
examples.english: Some people treat it as a joke, but it can hurt the person involved.
